node.title: Players must be vaccinated to take part in Australian Open, says tournament director Craig Tiley
node.alt: Tennis player smiling with the Australian Open trophy after winning the tournament
node.description: Tournament director Craig Tiley ends speculation over next year's Australian Open, confirming all players — including world number one Novak Djokjovic — must be vaccinated to play at Melbourne Park.
node.content: ["Australian Open tournament director Craig Tiley has ended speculation, confirming all players must be vaccinated to play\u00a0in next year's event at Melbourne Park.", "The announcement increases the pressure on world number one Novak Djokovic, who has so far refused to confirm whether or not he has been vaccinated against COVID-19.", "Speaking on Channel Nine, Tiley said Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews had outlined the position for the tournament.", "\"It's been made very clear, when the Premier announced several weeks ago that in order to participate at the Australian Open, to come into Victoria, you\u2019ll need to be fully vaccinated,\" he said.", "\"Immediately we communicated that to the playing group, it is the one direction that you take that is going to ensure everyone\u2019s safety.", "\"All the playing group understands it, our patrons will need to be vaccinated, all the staff working at the Australian Open will need to be vaccinated.", "\"But when we\u2019re in a state where there\u2019s more than 90 per cent of the population fully vaccinated, they\u2019ve done a magnificent job with that, it\u2019s the right thing to do.\"", "More to come."]
